test.name: Launch Application And Get App Load Time

kw.name: Start Video Recording
kw.doc: Starts the recording of a video in the background with the specified ``name``. The recording can be stopped by calling the `Stop Video Recording` keyword.

kw.name: Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/writing-running-appium/server-args.md | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias |

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Start Screen Recording
kw.doc: Starts an asynchronous Screen Recording for the current open application.

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Stop Screen Recording
kw.doc: Gathers the output from the previously started screen recording to a media file, then embeds it to the log.html(Android Only).

kw.name: Sleep

kw.name: Stop Video Recording
kw.doc: Stops the video recording corresponding to the given ``alias`` and generates the file in WebM format. If no ``alias`` is specified, the last opened recording will be closed. If there are more recordings with the same alias all of them will be closed. If ``embed`` argument was set to ``True`` the video will be displayed in the log file. Furthermore, if the ``save_to_disk`` parameter is set to ``False``, the video will be embedded and available in the log file only.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.
